result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  All applicable court costs, surcharges, assessments and DNA surcharge to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any amount remaining due and owing on 9/1/16 is subject to immediate  civil judgment.

08-28-15/ Carolina M Stark
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect  zero (0) days of sentence credit on Counts one & two.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence being served.

Provide DNA sample if not previously done so.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following resrictions: firearm possess and voting.
*As to both counts: drivers license suspension set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, consecutive to any other sentence being served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaquan Devonte Howard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 08-28-15 Court order for 0 days of sentence credit as to Counts 1 & 2
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
DOC request to review order for sentence credit.

Defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard in court with Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard in custody.  
Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Statements made as to sentencing by the state, defense, and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS of incarceration CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence being served with credit for 1 DAY (5-31-15). 

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS of incarceration CONCURRENT to Count 1, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence being served with credit for 1 DAY (5-31-15). 

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  The Court ordered that all applicable court costs, surcharges, assessments be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any amount remaining due and owing on 9-01-16 is subject to immediate civil judgment.  The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge.  Drivers license suspension set at zero.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Any motions due no later than 8-07-2015 at 1:30 pm Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 8-07-2015 at 1:30 pm, Branch 17. Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Calendar Call scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jaquan Devonte Howard in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
